intro: Tabebuia chrysotricha var. obtusata, commonly known as the Yellow Trumpet Tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The tree has a rounded canopy and produces large, heart-shaped leaves that are typically broad and glossy. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant flowers and ability to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates. The bark and wood of this species are also valued for their durability and aesthetic appeal.
